meanings.definition: A person who has successfully completed a course of study or training.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, the graduate proudly received their diploma.
meanings.sent2: The university held a ceremony to celebrate the new graduates.
meanings.sent3: The graduate's cap flew off in the wind, causing laughter among the crowd.
meanings.sent4: She was like a butterfly emerging from a cocoon, transformed into a graduate ready to take on the world.
meanings.sent5: The image of the graduate tossing their cap in the air is a symbol of achievement.

meanings.definition: To successfully complete a course of study or training.
meanings.sent1: She will graduate from high school next month.
meanings.sent2: Many students graduate with honors each year.
meanings.sent3: The cake will graduate from the oven when the timer goes off.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to graduate from a gentle stream to a roaring cascade.
meanings.sent5: The seeds will graduate into beautiful flowers with proper care.

meanings.definition: To mark with degrees of measurement.
meanings.sent1: The thermometer will graduate the temperature in both Celsius and Fahrenheit.
meanings.sent2: The ruler is used to graduate the length of the table.
meanings.sent3: The chef will graduate the ingredients by weight for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The artist will graduate the colors from light to dark in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The scale can graduate the weight of objects accurately.
